newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia 97/98 state budget to expand 11.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia 97/98 state budget to expand 11.6 pct.

text.p: Finance Minister Mar'ie Muhammad said on Monday Indonesia's 1997/98 budget would rise by 11.6 percent over 1996/97 to 101.09 trillion rupiah.

In a briefing before President Suharto presented the budget to parliament on Monday, Mar'ie said domestic revenues in 1997/98 (April/March) were projected to rise by 12.6 percent to 88.06 trillion rupiah.
He said non-oil revenue was projected to increase by 14.2 percent while oil revenue was seen growing by 5.3 percent in 1997/98.
"This shows that our domestic revenue structure has become more healthy ... that our dependence on oil and gas has become less," he told a budget briefing late on Sunday.
Suharto said Indonesia's 1996/97 state budget was 90.61 trillion rupiah.
